  "description": "Interswstik Nigeria Limited (ISNL) is a company engaged in the manufacturing and supply of plastic products. We specialize in producing high-quality plastic materials for various industrial and consumer applications, ensuring durability, functionality, and sustainability. Our operations are built around precision manufacturing, innovation, and meeting the diverse needs of clients across multiple sectors.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resource Manager / Admin&nbsp;

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikenne, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	The Plant Human Resources Manager is a key strategic partner to the plant leadership team.
	This role is responsible for overseeing all human resources functions within the manufacturing facility, ensuring a compliant, safe, and productive workplace.
	The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of HR principles, labor laws, and the unique challenges and needs of a manufacturing environment, including union relations, employee safety, and talent management for a diverse workforce.


Responsibilities
Strategic HR &amp; Workforce Planning:


	Collaborate with plant leadership to align HR initiatives with production goals and business objectives.
	Develop and execute HR strategies for talent acquisition, retention, and employee development that support the plant&#39;s operational needs.
	Conduct workforce planning to forecast labor needs and develop a talent pipeline for key roles, including skilled technicians and supervisors.
	Analyze HR metrics (e.g., turnover, absenteeism, safety incidents) to identify trends and implement solutions for continuous improvement.


Talent Acquisition &amp; Onboarding:


	Lead the full recruitment lifecycle for both hourly and salaried positions, from sourcing and screening to interviewing and hiring.
	Design and implement a comprehensive onboarding program to ensure new hires are well-prepared for the factory environment, with a strong focus on safety protocols and company culture.


Employee Relations &amp; Labor Relations:


	Act as a liaison between management and employees, fostering a positive work environment and open communication.
	Manage and resolve employee relations issues, grievances, and conflicts in a fair and timely manner.
	Administer and interpret collective bargaining agreements (if applicable) and advise management on union-related matters, including contract negotiations.
	Conduct thorough and impartial investigations into employee complaints, ensuring compliance with company policies and legal requirements.


Compensation, Benefits, &amp; Performance Management:


	Administer compensation and benefits programs, including payroll, health insurance, and retirement plans, ensuring they are competitive and compliant.
	Oversee the performance management process, including goal setting, performance reviews, and disciplinary actions.
	Develop and implement employee recognition and reward programs to motivate and retain high-performing staff.


Health, Safety, and Compliance:


	Ensure strict adherence to all federal, state, and local labor laws and regulations, including OSHA standards.
	Partner with the plant safety manager to develop and enforce safety policies and training programs.
	Manage workers&#39; compensation claims, return-to-work programs, and accident investigations.
	Maintain accurate and confidential HR records, including personnel files, attendance records, and other essential documentation.


Training &amp; Development:


	Assess the training needs of the workforce and develop and implement programs to enhance skills, improve performance, and support career growth.
	Facilitate training sessions on topics such as leadership, conflict resolution, and compliance.
	Promote a culture of continuous learning and development throughout the plant.


Salary
N200,000 - N220,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;h.r@d2h.ngusing the Job Position as the subject of the email.&nbsp;",

We specialize in producing high-quality plastic materials for various industrial and consumer applications, ensuring durability, functionality, and sustainability. Our operations are built around precision manufacturing, innovation, and meeting the diverse needs of clients across multiple sectors.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resource Manager / Admin 

Job Location: Ikenne, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	The Plant Human Resources Manager is a key strategic partner to the plant leadership team.
	This role is responsible for overseeing all human resources functions within the manufacturing facility, ensuring a compliant, safe, and productive workplace.
	The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of HR principles, labor laws, and the unique challenges and needs of a manufacturing environment, including union relations, employee safety, and talent management for a diverse workforce.


Responsibilities
Strategic HR & Workforce Planning:


	Collaborate with plant leadership to align HR initiatives with production goals and business objectives.
	Develop and execute HR strategies for talent acquisition, retention, and employee development that support the plant's operational needs.
	Conduct workforce planning to forecast labor needs and develop a talent pipeline for key roles, including skilled technicians and supervisors.
	Analyze HR metrics (e.g., turnover, absenteeism, safety incidents) to identify trends and implement solutions for continuous improvement.


Talent Acquisition & Onboarding:


	Lead the full recruitment lifecycle for both hourly and salaried positions, from sourcing and screening to interviewing and hiring.
	Design and implement a comprehensive onboarding program to ensure new hires are well-prepared for the factory environment, with a strong focus on safety protocols and company culture.


Employee Relations & Labor Relations:


	Act as a liaison between management and employees, fostering a positive work environment and open communication.
	Manage and resolve employee relations issues, grievances, and conflicts in a fair and timely manner.
	Administer and interpret collective bargaining agreements (if applicable) and advise management on union-related matters, including contract negotiations.
	Conduct thorough and impartial investigations into employee complaints, ensuring compliance with company policies and legal requirements.


Compensation, Benefits, & Performance Management:


	Administer compensation and benefits programs, including payroll, health insurance, and retirement plans, ensuring they are competitive and compliant.
	Oversee the performance management process, including goal setting, performance reviews, and disciplinary actions.
	Develop and implement employee recognition and reward programs to motivate and retain high-performing staff.


Health, Safety, and Compliance:


	Ensure strict adherence to all federal, state, and local labor laws and regulations, including OSHA standards.
	Partner with the plant safety manager to develop and enforce safety policies and training programs.
	Manage workers' compensation claims, return-to-work programs, and accident investigations.
	Maintain accurate and confidential HR records, including personnel files, attendance records, and other essential documentation.


Training & Development:


	Assess the training needs of the workforce and develop and implement programs to enhance skills, improve performance, and support career growth.
	Facilitate training sessions on topics such as leadership, conflict resolution, and compliance.
	Promote a culture of continuous learning and development throughout the plant.

Hotel Manager Job at Invealth Partners Limited




        
    

        
        
     

            
    

Invealth Partners Limited is an Investment and Management company with a focus on creating investment opportunities and strategic partnerships in the African continent. The company is poised to create efficiency and viability in the Infrastructure, healthcare, energy, retail and commodity sector while attracting investment and management of this portfolio to ensure sustainable growth and directly impact on service delivery across targeted ecosystems.  Invealths strategy is one that takes advantage of the need for entry into the African opportunity marmet and developes strategies, models and vehicles that are familiar to investors especially financial management and value growth over an acceptable period. Our company and processes are designed to give investor confidence, and we have a due diligence process that ensures that we only partner in the value based solutions.

Invealth Partners serve to create a link between business opportunities and investors, either private or institutional, with a mid to long-term overview. Our business focus is guided by a strong Environment, Social and Government partnership justification. Africa is the next investment destination…Invealth provides the strategic partnership that provides holistic value.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Hotel Manager
Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers 
Employment Type: Full time

About the Job


	We are looking to hire a well experienced Hotel Manager to oversee all aspects of our hotel operations.
	The ideal candidate will have a strong background in hospitality management and a passion for delivering exceptional guest experiences.
	The Hotel Manager will be responsible for the overall management and operation of the hotel, ensuring high standards of guest satisfaction, operational efficiency, and profitability. This role involves strategic planning, financial management, staff leadership, and maintaining the hotel's reputation for excellence.


Main Duties


	Develop and implement strategic plans to enhance hotel performance and guest experience
	Monitor industry trends and implement innovative practices to maintain competitiveness
	Oversee budget preparation and management for all departments
	Analyze financial reports and implement strategies to optimize revenue and control costs
	Ensure smooth daily operations across all departments
	Oversee recruitment, training, and performance management of staff
	Collaborate with the marketing team to develop effective promotional strategies
	Build and maintain relationships with key clients and partners
	Implement and maintain quality control standards for all hotel services
	Ensure delivery of exceptional guest experiences
	Handle guest complaints and feedback effectively
	Lead, motivate, and develop a high-performing team
	Ensure compliance with all relevant health, safety, and environmental regulations
	Implement and maintain emergency and security procedures


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Hospitality Management, Business Administration, or related field
	Minimum of 7 years of experience in hotel management, with at least 3 years in a management role in a hotel in Port-Harcourt.
	Must be a Port-Harcourt resident
	Strong financial acumen and experience in budgeting and revenue management
	Excellent leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills


Salary Range
N200,000 - N2050,000 monthly.

Other Benefits:


	Health Cover
	Leave

At Zojatech, we consider ourselves your partners, and we take care of your technology so that you can focus on your business. The goal of every member of our team is to make your business challenge-free, maximize your productivity, enable you better serve your customers, and most importantly, enable the digital success of your business.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head of Engineering

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilitie


	As the Head of Engineering, you will be responsible for directing, administering, and coordinating the entire Product &amp; Engineering business (Zojatach/Zojapay) in accordance with policies, goals, and objectives established by the CEO.
	You will oversee ongoing core business operations within the company.
	Assist the Chief Technical Officer in the development of enterprise/organization policies and goals that optimize financial and corporate performance and facilitate the growth of the company.
	You will be responsible for developing, leading and managing all commercial activities of the business, as well as including market competitiveness, product definition/pricing and distribution/diversity strategies.
	You will be accountable for effective and efficient technical operations of the company and for managing all operational risks to reduce their negative impacts to as low as reasonably possible.
	You will ensure that all technical operational controls are in place and working, and that the enterprise works in compliance with all related regulations.
	Develop and execute the technology strategy in alignment with the company&#39;s goals.
	Provide visionary leadership to the technology team, fostering a culture of innovation and excellence.
	Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies to drive continuous improvement.
	Set up the organization &amp; processes to enable timely delivery of projects with high quality.
	Set up best practices for development and champion their adoption.
	Oversee Architecture &amp; design of technically robust, flexible and scalable solutions.
	Engage with product management and CTO to drive the functionality, usability and other non-functional requirements and hence the solution for the same.
	Ensure on-time launches by managing design, development, and integration efforts according to a standard or customized project plan.
	Show strong business and technical judgment that will accelerate time to market of releases, while incrementally moving our services towards the long-term vision.
	Ensure the security, scalability, and reliability of our platform.


Team Management:


	Build and lead a high-performing technology, providing mentorship, guidance, and professional development opportunities for the engineering team.
	Foster a collaborative and inclusive work environment that encourages creativity and problem-solving.
	Be a champion of engineering excellence: establish team metrics for measurement of engineering and operational excellence. Implement a consistent, regular process for assessment and improvement.


Requirements


	Deep Understanding of enterprise grade technologies.
	Experience in building and running distributed systems for 24x7 online services at scale.
	Deep understanding &amp; expertise with highly transactional, large relational and complex systems.
	Knowledge of Object-Oriented Design, data structures, algorithm design, and complexity analysis.
	Experience in defining and executing professional software engineering best practices for the full software development life cycle.
	Strong analytic and quantitative skills; ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions, recommendations, and drive actions.
	Strengths in problem-solving, issue resolution, ability to work in a deadline-driven work environment, attention to detail, and ability to multitask.
	Strong verbal and written communication skills with a demonstrated experience. Engaging and influencing peers and executives.
	A strong sense of ownership, urgency and drive.
	Being a strong leader, mentor, and people manager.
	Startup and Entrepreneurial mindset.
	Execution oriented.
	Ability to think big.
	Collaborative mindset.


Types of applications built: Mobile Apps, Websites, API Applications:


	Backend: Laravel (PHP), MySQL.
	Architecture: Microservices / Serverless with AWS and Azure.
	Frontend: React, React Native, Redux.


Regulatory Compliance:


	Stay informed about regulatory changes and compliance requirements in the financial services industry (Nigeria and major Global markets).
	Minimum 10 years in an ICT Operating environment with hands on experience on Application Solutions, Sales, Business Process,
	Ensure that the platform complies with all relevant laws and regulations.
	University degree in Computer Science, Technology related courses, Engineering, or other numerate disciplines
	Certification in Product Management, Software Engineers, Sales, Business process automation and Business Development.
	Master&rsquo;s Degree in Business Administration, Economics, Finance, Information Technology or related fields from a recognized University will be an advantage.
	Qualification in a recognized framework for IT service delivery; ITIL, Business process automation and Business Development certification
	Membership of professional management associations will be an added advantage
	Designing, Business Development, Research and executive management and at least
	6 years in senior management positions


Method of Application

Accountant Job at Hollymarks Insurance Plc




        
    

        
        Hollymarks Insurance plc incorporated on 26 July, 1991 as a private limited liability company and became a public limited liability company, quoted on the Nigerian Stock Exchange in 1997. The organisation was established to conduct insurance business in a professional, ethical and customer-focused manner. As part of its corporate brand strategy, the company implemented a re-branding exercise in 2008 to position Hollymarks as a leader in the industry, part of which was the unveiling of the new corporate identity for the company.
     

            
    



The Company is licensed and re-certified by the National Insurance Commission (NAICOM) to do both General and Life businesses. The classes of Insurance business, we currently underwrite include: Motor Vehicle, Aviation, Marine, Engineering All Risks, Asset Protection, Liability to Third Party, Oil & Gas, Group Life, Credit Life, Mortgage Protection,Term Assurance, Wealth Creation Products and Takaful (Islamic Insurance).

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant
Job Location: Marina, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are looking for an Accountant to manage all financial transactions, from fixed payments and variable expenses to bank deposits and budgets.


Responsibilities


	Manage all accounting transactions
	Prepare budget forecasts
	Publish financial statements in time
	Handle monthly, quarterly and annual closings
	Reconcile accounts payable and receivable
	Ensure timely bank payments
	Compute taxes and prepare tax returns
	Manage balance sheets and profit/loss statements
	Report on the company’s financial health and liquidity
	Audit financial transactions and documents
	Reinforce financial data confidentiality and conduct database backups when necessary
	Comply with financial policies and regulations.


Requirements


	Excellent knowledge of accounting regulations and procedures, including the Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP)
	Have a knowledge of accounting software like FreshBooks and QuickBooks
	Advanced MS Excel skills including Vlookups and pivot tables
	Experience with general ledger functions
	Strong attention to detail and good analytical skills.


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 / month

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hollymarksplc@gmail.com using the Job Positon as the subject of the email.
